Marico is overrated.

Need not be rigid. Mistakes can be corrected. But over a period of time, bringing this discipline makes the journey lot easier.', 'Since I buy with an intention to hold for decade or decades, to me, margin of safety lies more on quality and less on price.', 'When I don‚Äôt act even on my own opinion of market directions, why should I worry about what experts say?', 'Not that we don‚Äôt have opinions about markets but seldom act on the same. But need to accept that companies like Nestle India are exceptional.", 'Woke up early because I slept till afternoon yesterday. https://t.co/BdwOfRo30f', "Been tracking Nestle India for close to two decades. Don't remember seeing it at cheap valuations ever. It's always an expensive stock. Remember reading that even in nineties, it traded at 80 to 90 PE.", 'The idea should be to buy companies which are rare sell. The kind of returns stocks like Pidilite have been giving me for last one decade is mind boggling.', 'Ordinary investors can create extraordinary wealth through patience.', 'Those who mock at 15% kind of returns have no clue what it can do to your wealth over 2 decades.', 'Reality: You can get rich in 20 years through prudent investing.

Desire: We want to be rich as of yesterday.

Desire fails. Reality wins.', 'No picture of family members, vacations, home, cars and so on. https://t.co/4FfKEhimc9', 'Only sages can can conquer fear of death. I accept death with fear. https://t.co/9IkHyKE8B6', "I'm educating my wife. Have given instructions what she should do if I don't live to see old age. https://t.co/1y5MVgoK7n", "Warren Buffett has not suggested to his wife even Berkshire stock after his life time. It's indexing, S&P 500, preferably Vanguard.", "If you're worried what your family would do with your investments after you're gone; indexing is the best solution. The country's main stock index has high probability of surviving for generations.", 'You can enjoy both investing and life better if you grasp the essence of mortality.', "That's why tracking the businesses is a must even for buy and hold investors.", 'In healthy times, we rarely feel about death. But death finally catches up.

In good times, no one would think a business can be destroyed. But destruction finally catches up.', "It's easier for me to pick businesses because very few show the promise of living for next 2 or 3 decades. Even there, it's only high probability. No 100% certainty.", 'I appreciate mortality more than anyone. Not even Nestle or Diageo would live forever. I look for business that are likely to survive my investing life. In the end, nothing lasts forever.', "It's normal for businesses to die. Many have a short life. Very few are endowed with long life.", 'Nothing is foolproof. Even huge growth can become a curse. From the summit, all roads lead only downwards.', "Amazon's ability to be customer centric, agile and being disruptive are unmatched. At some point, world would feel threatened by it's size and ambition. That may be the beginning of the end for Amazon. Businesses can die due to regulatory and legal actions too.", "We would grow not only due to our strengths but also because of China's goofups.", 'Let me give an example. I see how much Diageo India would be able to sell in next 5 years and the margins they would enjoy for premium products.

Some others are looking at last quarter earnings and find the PE to be expensive to buy.', "In the first few decades of last century, when percapita crossed certain thresholds, consumption exploded in USA. We are likely to see it in India during this and next decade.

Don't worry about private labels. Market would be very huge and it can accommodate everyone.", 'One book is enough. Coffee can investing. https://t.co/i10poXeOUJ', "We've no clue as to when percapita increases, what we consider normal in daily life; say honey or ghee would explode in consumption. For the world outside Indian Twitter, ghee and honey are currently luxury.", "Please read Saurabh's books and watch his videos. https://t.co/FNZJ5lgoBc", '@Vivek_Investor General insurance are usually one year contracts whereas life insurance contracts run into decades.', "Asian Paints go for only 3% yearly price hike.

Despite huge pricing power, Pidilite has capped it's margins at 25%

Disrupting these kind of market leaders is not easy.", "To be candid, MNCs are least bothered. They don't need our capital to run their businesses. Just that it's very difficult for them to delist. https://t.co/BXSTvxSt0a", 'HUL would one day be valued higher than Unilever.', 'What Nestle India earn as return on equity, even Nestle Switzerland cannot earn.

Saurabh Mukherjea is very right about abnormal profits and returns on equity earned by around 30 to 40 companies in India.', "Anything can happen. We're talking only in terms of probability. https://t.co/vL9qjuI6wY", "It's impossible for sectoral leaders in other countries to earn as return on equity what similar Indian companies earn.", "It's easier to disrupt banks by fintech companies. Not that easy for life insurance which are long term contracts running into decades.", 'As capitalism is very brutal, companies showing long term survivability with even moderate growth is valued high by markets.', 'Capitalism is very brutal. Only few businesses survive for long.']
